get.description: Get the details of a specific asset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id (not the asset tag) of the asset you'd like to query

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset to delete

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the asset you'd like to query

asset_tag.description: Unique asset tag of the asset

status_id.description: The id of the corresponding status label

model_id.description: The id of the associated asset model id

last_checkout.description: Date the asset was last checked out

assigned_to.description: The id of the user the asset is currently checked out to

company_id.description: The id of an associated company id

warranty_months.description: Number of months for the asset warranty

purchase_cost.description: Purchase cost of the asset, without a currency symbol

requestable.description: Whether or not the asset can be requested by users with the permission to request assets

archived.description: Whether or not the asset is archived. Archived assets cannot be checked out and do not show up in the deployable asset screens

rtd_location_id.description: The id that corresponds to the location where the asset is usually located when not checked out

get.description: Retrieve the specific details of a company by id

patch.description: Updates a part of a company's details

code-samples.code:
<?php
	
$access_token = 'YOUR-API-TOKEN';

// Set your new values
$fields = array(
  "name" => "Hogwarts", 
);          
    

$headers = array(
	'Content-Type: application/json',
	'Authorization: Bearer '.$access_token,
);

$ch = curl_init('https://your-server/api/v1/companies/1');


curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'YourScript/0.1 (contact@email)');
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PATCH');
curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($fields));

$data = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

print_r($data);

asset_tag.description: The asset tag of the asset. If auto-incrementing is enabled in the settings, this is not required and will be generated.

status_id.description: The id of the related status label

model_id.description: The id of the related asset model

rtd_location_id.description: The corresponding location_id from a location in the locations table that should indicate where the item is when it's NOT checked out to someone

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of results you wish to return. Defaults to 50, but we have it set to 2 by default so the API explorer doesn't scroll forever.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A text string to search the assets data for

parameters.name: order_number
parameters.description: Return only assets associated with a specific order number

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specify the column name you wish to sort by

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specify the order (asc or desc) you wish to order by on your sort column

parameters.name: model_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this asset model ID

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this status label ID

parameters.name: manufacturer_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this asset model ID

parameters.name: company_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this company ID

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this location ID

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to one of these status types: RTD, Deployed, Undeployable, Deleted, Archived, Requestable

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: Optionally restrict asset results to this status label ID

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to use when retrieving results (useful in pagination)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specify the number of results you wish to return

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A text string to search the assets data for

parameters.name: order_number
parameters.description: Return only assets associated with a specific order number

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specify the column name you wish to sort by

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specify the order (asc or desc) you wish to order by on your sort column

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Whether to include detailed information on categories, etc (true) or just the text name (false)

qty.description: Quantity of the accessory you have

category_id.description: ID number of the category the accessory belongs to

company_id.description: ID Number of the company the accessory is assigned to

location_id.description: ID number of the location the accessory is assigned to

manufacturer_id.description: ID number of the manufacturer for this accessory.

supplier_id.description: ID number of the supplier for this accessory

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to use when retrieving results (useful in pagination)

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Set this to "true" if you want to return only deleted users

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Set this to "true" if you want both deleted and active users

get.description: Retrieve a list of status labels

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to use when retrieving results (useful in pagination)

color.description: Hex code showing what color the status label should be on the pie chart in the dashboard

show_in_nav.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether the status label should show in the left-side nav of the web GUI

default_label.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether it should be bubbled up to the top of the list of available statuses

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to use when retrieving results (useful in pagination)

model_number.description: Part or model number of the model

eol.description: Number of months until this model's assets are considered EOL

fieldset_id.description: The ID of an EXISTING custom fieldset

model_number.description: Part or model number of the model

fieldset_id.description: The ID of an EXISTING custom fieldset

eol.description: Number of months until this model's assets are considered EOL

patch.description: Partially update a user, passing only the fields you want to modify

notes.example: Illum voluptatem laboriosam sit consequatur fugiat.

color.description: Hex code showing what color the status label should be on the pie chart in the dashboard

show_in_nav.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether the status label should show in the left-side nav of the web GUI

default_label.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether it should be bubbled up to the top of the list of available statuses

patch.description: Updates selected fields in a status label

color.description: Hex code showing what color the status label should be on the pie chart in the dashboard

show_in_nav.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether the status label should show in the left-side nav of the web GUI

default_label.description: 1 or 0 - determine whether it should be bubbled up to the top of the list of available statuses

category_type.description: (asset, accessory, consumable, component) - as of post-v5.2, this is no longer case sensitive

checkin_email.description: Should the user be emailed the EULA and/or an acceptance confirmation email when this item is checked in?

code-samples.code:
<?php
	
$access_token = 'YOUR-API-TOKEN';

$headers = array(
	'Content-Type: application/json',
	'Authorization: Bearer '.$access_token,
);

$ch = curl_init('https://your-server/api/v1/manufacturers');


curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'YourScript/0.1 (contact@email)');
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);

$data = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

print_r($data);

code-samples.name: Node

code-samples.code:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

url = URI("https://your-server/api/v1/categories")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request['Authorization'] = "Bearer YOUR-API-TOKEN"
request['Accept'] = "application/json"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

import requests

url = "https://your-server/api/v1/categories"
headers = {"Authorization":"Bearer YOUR-API-TOKEN", "Accept":"application/json"}

response = requests.request("GET", url)

print(response.text)

post.description: Checkout an asset to a user, location or another asset

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id (not the asset tag) of the asset you'd like to query

checkout_to_type.description: Type of entity the asset is being checked out to: user, asset, or location

assigned_user.description: The ID of the user to check the asset out to. Required if `checkout_to_type` is set to `user`

assigned_asset.description: The asset ID to associate the asset to. Required if `checkout_to_type` is set to `asset`

assigned_location.description: The location ID to check the asset out to. Required if `checkout_to_type` is set to `location`

expected_checkin.description: Optional date the asset is expected to be checked in

checkout_at.description: Optional date to override the checkout time of now

name.description: Optional new asset name. This is useful for changing the asset's name on new checkout, for example, an asset that was named "Anna's Macbook Pro" could be renamed on the fly when it's checked out to Elizabeth, to "Beth's Macbook Pro"

field_values.description: In the case of list boxes, etc, this should be a list of the options available

show_in_email.description: Whether or not to show the custom field in email notifications

field_encrypted.description: Whether the field should be encrypted. (This can cause issues if you change it after the field was created.)

help_text.description: Any additional text you wish to display under the new form field to make it clearer what the gauges should be.
